We stayed in the 'Beach House' which was wonderfully spacious and comfortable, we were able to spread out properly. Everything was immaculately clean and the bed was incredibly comfy. The bathroom was fantastic with a huge Jacuzzi bath, perfect for soaking weary feet after a day at the zoo! The hotel was so laid back and quiet, you felt as if you had it all to yourselves and we enjoyed having early evening drinks in the courtyard. San Diego itself was also great, very chilled, some great restaurants including the Strip Club where you grill your own meat, good value, delicious food. Our stay rounded off a superb holiday and if we ever return to San Diego, we will definitely be back at the Balboa!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Neptune48
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Balboa Park Inn. Its location was great and the roof garden was nice. The best part is that its walking distance to many sights.. the zoo, the park itself and some very nice restaurants. We also found it realistically priced for San Diego. I would recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “A great accommodation choice. Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: infolondon
Reviews.Content: I booked Balboa Park based on previous TripAdvisor reviews. They weren't wrong. This is an excellent place. The room was a good size, bed was comfortable and all the staff were friendly and helpful. In fact the cleaner even found a necklace which we had left in our room on check out. The hotel provides some nice touches like daily newspaper delivered to your room. I have struggled to find anything negative to mention. However I've come up with some advice should you consider staying here. - Breakfast - Breakfast is a choice of either cereals or croissants and buns. Both options come with fresh fruit. The croissants and buns are particular good, highly recommended. It is nice that they will deliver the breakfast to your room or outside terrace. However after about 3 or 4 days the options do become a bit repetitive. - Water pressure - The water pressure in the shower wasn't as powerful as ideally I would have liked. Although I'm sure this is outside of the hotel's control. - Location - The hotel location is good, but possibly not for everyone. If you don't drive (I don't) please consider the following. I considered the hotel to be in good safe neighbourhood and I felt safe when walking around the area at all times of day or night. It appears to be quite a residential area. The hotel is a 90 second walk to a bus stop for route 7 which runs into downtown. The bus service runs quite frequently about every 12 minutes in the day, and about every 20 minutes in the evening. It takes about 10 minutes to City College where you can transfer on to the San Diego trolley. The hotel is about 10 minute walk south to San Diego Zoo, Rose Garden and a few more minutes to attractions like the model railway museum. 10 minutes walk north of the hotel on to university avenue is Starbucks, 7 11, other restaurants and bars. From university avenue you can catch bus 10 to old town. - Flowers - The flowers in the room are artificial. Not a problem, but might be worth noting. - Pizza delivery - Like a lot of places Balboa Park Inn provides some local information leaflets in the room. One was for the Broadway Pizza delivery service. We decided to use this one night. I have never tasted such a terrible pizza. Obviously this isn't the hotel fault, but I wouldn't recommend ordering from Broadway Pizza during your stay. - Overall - Overall Balboa Park is an excellent choice at a very fair price. I would certainly recommend it and would definitely stay there again. The only reason I've given 4 stars instead of 5 is because the hotel is a 10 minutes walk from shops, restaurants and bars. But I was aware of this when booking, so this wasn't really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “We Love The Balboa Park Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: MEKWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our fourth visit and will most definitely stay here again. Unlike the many hotels with their "cookie cutter" rooms, this inn is charming and unique. Each room or suite is decorated differently and beautifully furnished. Breakfast was once again delivered to us in our suite or on the terrace or upstairs deck and consisted of pastries or cereal and milk, fruit, coffee and juice. The front desk staff has always been helpful and friendly. I give high praise to the housekeeping staff. Our rooms have always been immaculate and the beds very comfortable. We enjoyed the additions of LCD flat panel television and free wireless internet access, which were both added since our last stay. The location of this delightful little inn is within walking distance of the San Diego Zoo and restaurants, museums and exhibits at beautiful Balboa Park. It is in a nice neighborhood and we felt safe there. We are already looking forward to our next opportunity to make the Balboa Park Inn our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “STILL Our Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Stephani
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mayfair Suite at the Balboa Park Inn for 7 nights during spring break. This was our second stay at the Balboa Park Inn and it was even better than the first. It truly feels like a home away from home. The location is excellent,n a quiet residential neighborhood that is iwithin walking distance of the zoo and Balboa Park, close to the restaurants and grocery stores in Hillcrest and a short distance from downtown. Our suite was huge, with 2 bedrooms, a living room and a full kitchen that opens onto the terrace. The free breakfast is brought to your room or to the terrace. We found the fresh fruit, cereal, milk and juice to be more than enough food. The beds are very comfortable. The public places (such as the halls, the outdoor terrace and sun porch), and our room, were kept very clean. The disinfectant smell that others have mentioned is present in the hall but we did not notice it at all anywhere in our suite. We did not have any problem parking either directly in front of our building or within a few yards from it. I felt very safe in this neighborhood, even in the evening. think the management and staff really set this place apart. They are all very helpful and are more than willing to provide suggestions for restaurants and directions for getting around. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in San Diego and have already booked our next stay..

Reviews.Title: “Special Secret Retreat”
Reviews.Author: steve42
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a trip for daughter's wedding to newly graduated Marine. Wasn't sure what to expect, but was very impressed with this quaint little inn. We stayed in the Las Palomas suite with great private balcony that overlooks Park Blvd and Balboa Park. It was very comfortable and we really enjoyed sitting on the balcony for the complimentary continental breakfast and our after dinner coffee. Staff provided us with solid recommendations for restaurants in area that were very reasonable (for San Diego). We would recommend this place to anyone who wants something different and doesn't need a luxury hotel where all the rooms look the same.

Reviews.Title: “Love it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: kmplace2029
Reviews.Content: Came to San Diego on business and did not want to stay downtown.. Chose very well.. had a lovely suite (3 room) and loved the roof top lounge area. Internet: off and on which can be a problem since I was there on business but it wasn't that too much of a slow down/ did not bother me enough not to return next month Staff went out of their way for great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, inexpensive, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RottHound
Reviews.Content: My 4-year-old son and I stayed in the California Suite. It was a good size for us. It was essentially a very small apartment with a full kitchen (minus dishwasher), small dining room table, bedroom, and living room area. There was a tiny outdoor area too. Not really a deck, but sort of an enclosure. My son enjoyed running his trains and cars out there and I didn't have to worry about him because it's fenced from the street. PROS: --Close to everything. We rented a car and our longest drive was 12 minutes to Coronado. Balboa Park, Old Town, downtown, and the charming Hillcrest neighborhood were all very close. If I didn't have a small child, I wouldn't have rented a car at all. THe public transport there is great. --Very accommodating staff.. There were a few things missing from the kitchen (knife, pancake turner, hot pads) and they delivered them to the room one at a time, as I discovered what I needed. They gave me lots of recommendations and directions to places and were very friendly. And they were willing to let me have housekeeping every other day, instead of every day. I don't like to waste the water it takes to change all the bedding and towels every day (which I would never do in my own home!) and because I feel compelled to tidy up for the cleaning staff, it's less work for me if I don't have to worry about them coming in every day. --Inexpensive. It's hard to find a 1-bedroom with a full kitchen anywhere else in San Diego for under $200. Having a kitchen saves a lot of money too. We ate many breakfasts and dinners in the room, paying only to eat out for lunch while we were sightseeing. --Clean. The place was kept quite clean. --Easy and free parking. In a week, we only had two times we had a hard time finding a parking space on Upas St. Once, on Earth Day, when 60,000 people came to Balboa Park and took up a LOT of parking spaces! And the other on a day when we came back to the room at about 3 pm and there were cars lining the street with parents in them, waiting to pick up their kids from the middle school across the street. In both cases, we drove around the block 3 or 4 times and finally found a space in front of the inn. Not really a big deal. I must say that San Diego in general is a nirvana of free parking. I come from Seattle, land of expensive pay parking, so it was amazing to me that there was lots of free parking at Balboa Park, the zoo, Old Town, Coronado beaches. We never once paid for parking. Try that when you go to Seattle Center or Pike Place Market! CONS: --The rooms in the California Suite were very small. The bedroom pretty much only had room for the bed and night stands. I had a pack-and-play in there and it was wedged between the bed and wall and you couldn't walk around it. The dining area was also cramped and I think it would be difficult to seat 4 people there. The kitchen had very little prep room. For the price, we didn't mind, but if you had more than 3 people, it would probably be too cramped. --The smell of the cleaning solutions they use were pretty overpowering, as several people have pointed out. I opened all the windows and the door to air it out the night we got there and by morning, it was better. The fabulous thing though is that all I had to do was mention it to the front desk and they arranged for the cleaners not to use anything smelly while I was there. Problem solved easily and painlessly. --Noise in our room. Our room was at the bottom of the staircase, right next to the main door for our building, so we heard every guest come in (slam!) and leave (slam!) and haul their luggage up and down the steps (bump, bump, bump). Fortunately, when we had the bedroom door shut, we couldn't hear it. Mostly we just heard it while we were up and around. But if you have a baby who needs to nap during the day, it's something to think about. Overall, we had a great time and I plan to go back to the Balboa Park Inn as soon as I can afford it. A week was not enough to see all the stuff we wanted to see and still fit in plenty of beach time!

Reviews.Title: “Right by the ZOO!”
Reviews.Author: perky2you
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Balboa Park Inn during the month of March. It was a beautiful time of year. The staff was super friendly. We stayed in unit 23. I called to book and told them we had a 3 month old. They put a pack and play in the room for us. They also put a hair dryer in the room so I wouldnt have to drag it cross-country. We had a 3 bedroom suite. It was PERFECT for us! The staff brought pastries and fruit everyday, coffee/tea was in the room. The kitchen was great for us since we had an infant. We could walk to the San Diego Zoo, couldn't be more then 1/2 mile away. The area is across from a school however we never heard any commotion. It's a very convenient location. They have $99 rooms, and the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “"There's a jungle out there..."”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: One reviewer in October was horrified at the furnishing of the Greystoke Room. She should have seen Jungle Nook (#28) with its bronze gorilla perched over the jacuzzi, a jaguar by the breakfast nook, and a huge elephant head with tusks suspended over the bed. The assessment for this hotel/inn/motel (it defies description but the sign on the building says "unique bed and breakfast") is based primarily on Jungle Nook and a few observations on the management team. But first of all, the location right near Balboa Park is excellent. You do not even need a car. Bus #7 can take you either to the zoo or to the Museum Place (one direction) or to Central Station (the other). Bus tickets are $2.25 general and $1.00 seniors. I have never found such friendly and helpful people as on the bus. Well done! If you elect to eat in the park, the Cohn Brothers' Prado restaurant is one of the best in town. The bar menu is served all day and will save you half the dinner fare. The restaurant itself, Mediterannean fare, will run $100 for two, with drinks and a full meal. Excellent variety from duck quesadillas to mushroom risotto. So much has already been said about the quirkiness of the rooms but I need to mention specifically the lack of seating in Jungle Nook. There are no chairs in the bedroom. If you wish to sit, there is a table with two chairs in--get ready--the huge bathroom. This is a room with double shower and enormous jacuzzi tub. (Remember the lines "water, water, everywhere"?) To the side of this room is the breakfast table. You will be able to nibble at pastries and cereal while watching the two bath options outfitted with jaguar and gorilla. There is a separate bathroom with dual sinks and toilet (no chairs here but there is a hat rack, if you wish). Yes, you can have your breakfast outside and I would encourage you to do so if the weather is nice. You call to have breakfast brought to you, and you call when you wish your room to be serviced. There is NO window in the Jungle Nook, unless you count the tiny windows over the jacuzzi which can be opened only by scaling the tiles behind the tub. I do need to mention that Paris in the 30's, at a far lower rate, is delightful and airy. Claustrophobes need not worry. But Sunday night there might be some major concern with the management team. We needed to phone the front desk Sunday night at 7:30 PM. There was no one. At 8:30 PM, still there was no one. Also, there is another major glitch. We were told that upon check-in, our credit card would be charged the full balance on the spot. We accepted this. But when we checked in, the charges had already been made and using the original card. Since I intended to use my credit card for the balance (my wife paid the first night's deposit), the management had to void the subsequent charge and credit her the balance and then charge on my card. Fortunately, the desk was charming and helpful despite all this. Our taxi was waiting for us promptly to take us back to the airport. Figure under $20 including tip each way from and to the airport. We managed to see quite a bit of the immediate area by taking local transport. Yes, I recommend Balboa Park Inn. There is so much charm and the location is superb. At least we know what to expect and what to avoid next time.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: ktbradshaw88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "Paris in the 30's" room for several days. Very convenient for nice walks in Balboa Park, a few blocks from a "strip" of restaurants, close to bus stop. Felt safe walking after dark. In-room breakfast was a nice touch, although the "boxed pastry-and fruit" was nothing to rave about. Room was well-laid-out and private - - nice having a fridge and microwave. As others mentioned, there was a very odd, unpleasant smell in the room (not quite musty, but couldn't identify). My only other complaint was that one of the manager-types at the front desk used crass, disparaging language directed at the housekeeping staff within my presence. Rather unprofessional. Otherwise, the staff was very helpful in making recommendations for location shops, bus lines, etc. Easy to get on and off the freeway, but parking may be tight, depending on the time of day.

Reviews.Title: “The small things made the difference...”
Reviews.Author: cjmehlauge
Reviews.Content: We´ve been there for two nights and it was worth every dollar. The City-Lights-Room was not so big, but very clean and really cozy. The Room was equipped with a microwave, a kettle, a fridge and a small TV. What made this B&B so special and lovely were little things like the milk-pyramide (see picture) or the way they fold the towels. They also tidied up the bathroom and put our stuff (thoothbrushes and toothpaste) in the mirror-cabinet. The thing was that we haven´t noticed this special mirror-cabinet yet and the service-personal was so smart to let the door of the mirror-cabinet a little bit open, so we could mention it. Every morning was a daily newspaper at the door. (This is also a special service) The B&B had also a big, beautiful courtyard and a huge sun-terrace where you could eat your breakfast or relax if you want. Very nice!! The breakfast was ok, but nothing special (this is the only thing we were a little disappointed about.) If the stuff would provide a fresh cooked breakfast, than this B&B could be excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a nice walk”
Reviews.Author: thai2007
Reviews.Content: Selected Balboa Park Inn based on Trip Advisor reviews, and was certainly pleased. My favorite feature was its location relative to amenities, safe and convenient for a walk into the park, of course, but I (single female) also felt very safe walking in the residential neighborhoods at dusk and early a.m., with great interest in looking at homes and daydreaming about living in a San Diego bungalow. We took a cab downtown to Gaslight for $10 each way, but didn't do enough research to find that it is not served by the fantastic Trolley line which we used to explore the rest of the city. Ronnie in the office was helpful in pointing out options for walking, bus, or cabs to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like A Little Apartment”
Reviews.Author: MrsLisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a limited stay in San Diego so I wanted a hotel within walking distance of a major attraction. In this case, the zoo. The street parking for us was no problem as has been mentioned in previous reviews. I don't know if it is worse on the weekend but certainly was not a problem at all on the Thursday night we stayed there. - The staff was friendly and helpful. The Monet unit was cute as could be on the second floor with 4 separate rooms basically; bedroom; bathroom; sitting room and kitchen, so it felt like a little apartment more than a hotel. It also had a little patio area shared by the next unit. - There was some construction going on (not a problem as far as noise) but I think the patio area is getting some renovation and was a little bit of a mess. Decor is not fancy, by the way, but very comfortable. (I can't review the other units; speaking for the Monet unit in paraticular.) - Restaurants of all kinds are a few blocks away on University Drive. I believe there are some within walking distance as well but all kinds of choices and lots of people out and about on University Drive. - So, good location (especially if you prefer quiet residential to big city feel), friendly staff, comfortable bed and set up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: elwood9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Balboa Park Inn with 2 young children. The "continental" breakfasts pushed the definition of continental breakfast, with a wonderful selection of pastries and fruit. We stayed in the California Suite. We had a living space and a kitchen dining space, that were separated by a narrow hall, with a very small bedroom off the hall. We were able to set up the kids in the dining area at night (a bench seating/bed worked perfectly for the 3 year old, while the 1 year old was in a pack-n-play. This let us stay up and watch a little TV at night. We really enjoyed this hotel. The proximity to the zoo and other park amenities was incredible. And the staff made us feel very welcome and comfortable. Would highly recommend to anyone. This suite would be good for a couple, or a couple with small children. With older children one should definitely consider one of the larger suites.

Reviews.Title: “Old School, but Charming”
Reviews.Author: BackpackGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Balboa Park Inn for a week during the wildfires in SD this fall, and they were super-concerned about my health and safety given all the bad stuff floating around the air. They purified the room everyday and kept the windows shut. The staff were very courteous and I didn't find parking to be a big problem. The breakfast delivery was nice - but I wished it were a heartier meal. It felt a bit uninspired - fruit and a danish. I could buy that at Starbucks! The bed was comfortable and while the building was old, it was clean. That's always important to me. While it wasn't a stellar inn, I found it's ambience perfectly charming, and very SoCal.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon at Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: theryguy23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a romantic, well-located and well-priced hotel to spend our honeymoon in San Diego. We found everything we were looking for at the Balboa Park Inn. Breakfast was a great way to start our days. I really liked how they delivered it up to the rooms. We stayed five nights in the City Lights room and 3 in the beach house. Though the city lights room was nice (clean, but a little old), the beach house was definitely the best part of our stay. Our only annoyance for our stay would have to be the constant phone calls we got from the front desk in the morning asking when the maids could come in. One day it was three calls in a couple hours... on our honeymoon. Besides that we were thrilled with the hotel and would come back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Best we have ever been treated anywhere !!”
Reviews.Author: Redovergreen_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1/30,31/2008. was given a room upgrade without even asking ! Breakfast delivered to our room was not your ordinary continental hotel style. Rolls and coffee cake was nice and warm with your choice of juice plus fruit.. Room or should i say suite was simply exquisite and the staff made you feel like you never wanted to go home.Don't let the very reasonable rate scare you,this is the best place I've ever stayed in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Charm”
Reviews.Author: free2read
Reviews.Content: With a funky, eccentric 1930s boarding house feel that's definitely not for the Marriot Rewards set, the Balboa Inn is a perfect blend of kitsch and comfort. Our room, Paris in the '30s, had a canopy bed, an old-fashioned chaise lounge, and an ornate Victorian fireplace mantle -- complete with fake electric fire. Think elegant AND tacky. It was also very private, very quiet, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Who could want more?! We found it a delightful change from the bland cookie cutter rooms found in your standard hotel chain. The location is perfect; it's tucked into a quiet residental neighborhood with very lttle traffic (we slept with the windows open and didn't hear a sound) that's a short walk to the SD Zoo. It's also a great walking and jogging area. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, the continental breakfast is more than adequate, and our only complaint was that on the street parking can be tight. An earlier reviewer complained of the musty smell that we have found in many older hotels -- we always carry an aromatic candle with us. That and an open window will quickly clear the air and add a little romantic atmsophere. Restaurants are scarce in the immediate neighborhood, but the Cafe on Park is about a mile up the street . It serves an awesome breakfast with pizza sized pancakes that are locally famous. There is also a Farmers Market grocery where you can pick up fresh fruit, sandwiches, drinks and any other items you want to keep in the in-room frig. Dinner restaurants will require a trek. Ask at the front desk for recommendtions and directions. The Balboa Park Inn has become our new San Diego home away from home. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Great Little Inn”
Reviews.Author: Thelrose
Reviews.Content: I booked this Inn for our Thanksgiving stay with family in San Diego. We were int he Victoria's Secret room and absolutley loved it. The bed was extremely comfortable with a nice reading lamp for each side of the bed. There was a beautiful chaise lounge that also had a nice lamp. The owners think of everything here. Towels were plentiful and there was a mini frig, microwave and all the necessary items for coffee, tea, hot chocolate, etc. We were impressed with the amount of food for breakfast - huge amount of pastries and fruit. The 2nd day we cut back on the pastries and got one cereal and still couldn't finish everything. The location here is great. Walk to zoo and museums in Balboa Park. Bus stop is on the corner and a short walk to University Ave for restaurants and stores. We asked the hotel to recommend a restaurant for us right after our arrival and he recommeded Cafe Eleven. It was such a good meal that we went back the night before we left. For the price, you can't beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank without the flight time....”
Reviews.Author: murphysmum
Reviews.Content: GREAT HOTEL....I didn't take a lot of time selecting this hotel; it was only for one night and I simply wanted something after an event in Balboa Park...close to the Park....to avoid a two hour trip home. I haven't found a hotel room for $99 in several years so I was expecting "very average". What a pleasant surprise! The hotel room reminded me of what you WISH you'd find on the Left Bank in Paris, only this one was perfect! It wasn't huge, but comfortably held a queen size canopy bed with white lace topper (very comfortable), a huge chaise lounge (to die for), some decorative pieces and a built in holding a small refrigerator with a microwave and coffee maker on top. The room was well supplied with up do date travel brochures and information on local restaurants. Great ambiance and charm. Predominate dark green, brown and white make the room cheerful and bright and extremely inviting. I appreciated the lighting, often a neglected item. This room contained a floor lamp, a wonderful reading lamp next to the chaise and two bedside wall lamps with decorative shades. The room wasn't fancy...no marble tubs... but I give it 10+ for the charm, cleanliness and comfort factors. Staff were very nice when I made the reservation, explaining the different rooms, pros and cons. When we were arrived everything was in order; I was asked if I needed a hairdryer, iron or anything and they were brought to our room immediately. Breakfast was simple but plentiful...fresh fruit, juice, cereal, assorted muffins and pastries...excellent hot tea and coffee. We simply called and it was brought to our room within five minutes. We additional had the choice of eating in the lovely courtyard, but I really didn't want to leave the room. Since I live only two hours north, I stay in San Diego several times a year for various reasons. I have always stayed downtown so that I could have a view of the water. Having stayed at the Balboa Park Inn, I'll be forgoing the water view for this cozy get away. For those who don't know San Diego well, this is an excellent location if you have access to a car. Parking is free on the street. You can walk across the street to the zoo if you're with kids...or if you're a big kid. You have easy access to the marvelous museums in Balboa Park, as well as being conveniently located to anywhere else you'd want to go in San Diego. The price for value is amazing; it's a great place for a family to stay. Warning: If you like chain, cookie cutter hotels, this is not the place for you. If you like uniqueness, warmth and charm...I'd go back in a heartbeat...and will. Enjoy your travels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Balboa Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: ahild
Reviews.Content: We were one of the many families that were evacuated during the San Diego fires. The people at the Balboa Park Inn were so kind, gracious, and helpful that I had to write this memo. This is the first time I have ever written a review on a hotel. When they greeted us on our arrival, they gave us their names. The room we stayed in was really 4 rooms - bathroom, kitchen, living room and bedroom sitting room. Although this is an old bed and breakfast, the furnishings were so comfortable and cheerful that we were not as stressed. It is also so close to the zoo and many museums that we could have been entertained for quite a while. We only stayed for two nights, but the little girls (7 & 9) didn't want to leave. We're seniors and didn't want to stay at an evacuation center. We are visitng our daughter whose husband is returning in a few weeks from Iraq. We're from Ohio and certainly not familiar with wild fires. Ruth Anita Hildebrand, Beavercreek, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SR73
Reviews.Content: I'm usually more of a hotel fan but after reading about the Balboa Park Inn on this site, we decided to give it a go. I'm so glad we did! Friendly staff, comfortable room and breakfast brought to your room each morning. It's on the doorstep of the restaurants & bars of Hillcrest and is 5 mins by bus or car from downtown. It was a perfect base for us as we decided to travel around quite a bit. There is street parking but read the signs carefully - road sweeping means that on some days you must move your car by 10am or face a ticket (guess what I ended up with?!) Despite the $40 penalty - we had a great stay. The Balboa Park Inn isn't going to win any design or decor awards but it's warm, friendly and with your own fron door - incredibly private.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but tacky rooms and no parking”
Reviews.Author: married_traveler_31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here partly because of the great reviews on TripAdvisor. Our friends also stayed here too and between us, we saw three different rooms at this location. I am embarrassed to have recommended this place to our friends and feel compelled to write a more realistic review to save future travelers. Here is my take on the following: LOCATION- very good especially if you want easy access to the zoo and other downtown attractions. But note, they don’t have a parking lot so be prepared to be circling around the block to look for street parking. ROOMS and VALUE - depends on the room. Pay attention on which one you get because some of the décor is downright tacky. And all rooms are very old. The Monet’s room is decent and clean and for $149 per night is a good value. The Greystoke room is good for those that want that “zoo” feeling but for $219 per night isn‘t worth it unless you love, love, love, stuffed lions! And the Greystoke room is awful, do not pick this room, it is super tacky with a mix match of repainted furniture and odd scary looking fake plants. Service - Not sure because we hardly had any interface with the front desk folks. They seem nice enough. Breakfast - It’s just pastries and juice, not much to comment on. In summary, this is a harsh review but only because I am baffled at why it is rated so high by other travelers. I would rank this way lower than it’s current spot on the top ten San Diego Hotel list.

Reviews.Title: “Jungle Love”
Reviews.Author: spycygrl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last month for a little romantic weekend getaway from Los Angeles. Boyfriend's friends live literally 2 blocks away, so the location was key not only to hanging out with them, but also to the SD Zoo. We chose the Jungle Nook (after viewing all the pix of the rooms online) since we are both silly monkeys. The room faced the courtyard and was EXTREMELY quiet. A little overwhelming with all the "jungley" touches, but pretty hilarious. There is a plaster elephant head over the bed and a full-size bronze chimp in the bathroom! And, yes, a real Brass Monkey swinging near the shower. The jacuzzi tub (which we now call the "junguzzi") was heavenly and we partook of it all weekend. The double-shower is also fantastic since you don't waste time getting ready (everyone can shower at once!). Bed was very comfy and there was a selection of different pillows (very smushy to firm). The continental breakfast is brought to your room upon a quick phone call to the desk and was an entire TRAY of muffins, croissants and cinnamon rolls along with fresh melon and orange juice. The room has a mini fridge and a coffee maker with all the good condiments. The zoo is only about a 10 minute walk and there are excellent bars, restaurants and shopping within a brisk walk (or short drive). The neighborhood is cute and pleasant. We loved our little weekend getaway. It helped us fall in love.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the balboa Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: blr0408
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Medley Suite for a few days in early October. I booked it based on other reviews and my expectations were certainly met. The location is good....within walking distance to the Zoo and a couple museums. It is only a short drive to downtown or the beach areas. On street parking but the only day we experienced a problem was the day the zoo was offering free admission - there were crowds of people then but normally it seems like a quiet neighborhood. The room is uniquely decorated - a little quirky and outdated but in very good condition. The suite has a separate bedroom, living room, full kitchen, and bathroom - basically a one bedroom apartment. The kitchen door leads to the upper level deck which is very nice - a little oasis to sit and relax. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Anytime we needed more towels, had questions, etc, they were always quick and helpful. Breakfast delivered to the room is great - nothing special but it includes fruit, pastries, cereal, and juice. You can order coffee but there is a coffee maker in the room. You really can't beat this place...especially for the price. It is very reasonable priced, comfortable, and convenient. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “not as quirky as i thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: dundeetripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights early last month, based solely on trip advisor reviews, i feel a little bit disgruntled. From the hotel website i thught our room was going to be really quirky but disappointingly it was just a bit old fashioned. Clean but old fashioned. We did have a seperate kitchen, bedroom and living room which was really handy when we put our son to sleep and then we could just chill out with a bottle of wine in the living room. The breakfast is nothing to write home about, and was a couple of pieces of fruit, some oj and some microwaved danish pastries ( never had hot danish before ) obviously brought straight out of the freezer and defrosted ?. Any way its a short walk to balboa park and the zoo about 5-10 mins. The staff were helpful but we didn't really see them much. The only main problem was that the tv didn't work throughout our stay, when we rang down they stated it was a problem with their cable service. i don't know if this was true or not. The pictures of the decking looks really nice but most of these flowers are plastic ?. All in all i can't really see why this is so high in trip advisors list.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ssnamurray
Reviews.Content: I found the Balboa Park Inn online while trying to find a place to stay near the San Diego Zoo. Success - it's an easy ten-minute walk to the entrance. The building itself dates from around 1915, and the decor is eccentric. Outside and throughout the courtyard and decks there's a combination of plastic flowers and genuinely nice specimen plants. Decor is tacky but frivolous enough to make one smile. I stayed in the "Aruba Room," VERY private and quiet. $99 got me a private room with a large bath with Jacuzzi tub (great for tired feet after the Zoo!). When I called to request breakfast I was asked whether I preferred pastries and fruit, or cereal and fruit: I selected pastries and got a tray loaded with an orange, apple and watermelon slices, cheese danish, mini muffin, croissant AND fruit bread! I'd stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: djbnews
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Balboa Park Inn for our Honeymoon at the end of May, and we found it charming with a friendly staff and a *fantastic* location. We stayed in the Paris in the 30s room, which was cozy and quiet. The breakfasts are delivered to the room (basically, sweet rolls, juice and fruit). We were able to walk to the zoo and the front desk was able to make several recommendations for dinner. We arrived very early (10 a.m.) and very, very tired on the first day, and the staff was willing to send an extra cleaning person to our room right then so that we could check into our room early (it took about 20 minutes). We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: LA_Neener
Reviews.Content: I was in town for America's Finest City Half Marathon - this hotel is PERFECT for any runner that doesn't want the hassle of getting to the starting line/shuttles for AFC or San Diego Rock & Roll in June. The zoo and Balboa Park are a short walk down the hill - perfect! My honey and I were in the Greystoke for the night and loved it. The bed was SO comfortable, I wanted to stay one more night AFTER the race. Lots of space, fun decor, and just an overall great experience. If you are looking for something different and outside the box - I highly recommend the Balboa Park Inn. I just wish I could've enjoyed a nice leisurely breakfast in the courtyard or up on the sundeck, but missed out this trip. Will definitely book here for next June!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night based on Trip Advisor reviews. Great residential-area location -- right next to zoo and Balboa Park, close to Hillcrest for shops and restaurants, free street parking. At $99 + tax for City Lights suite it was quite a buy -- bedroom, living room with excellent TV, full kitchen, smallish bathroom. Furniture from 1950-60 but clean and in excellent condition. Nice continental breakfast we ate outside -- fresh fruit, sweet rolls, juice, coffee, cereal. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorGNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mayfair room recently. The rooms were very clean and it was like having our own small apt. A short walk to the zoo. Food is close by. The whole place is really not a true hotel but rather like your grandmothers well-kept, but old apartment with all it's quirky furniture and decor collected over a lifetime. Everything is old but well maintained and perfectly functional. The breakfasts are cut up fresh fruit along with generic grocery store danish/pastries warmed up in a microwave. But it does the trick and saves the hastle of going out for breakfast. If you can get over the fact that this is not a cookie cutter hotel you will enjoy the uniqueness (and value) of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: shellito1012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just enjoyed two nights in the beach house (room)...July 6th and 7th. I really liked the place and would definately stay there again and recommend this place to my friends and family. I had family visiting me there and they were staying in Old Town...they wished they had booked where we were simply because of how comfortable the bed was! I was exhausted when we arrived at the Balboa Park Inn and when I layed on the bed I thought I was in heaven. I love a good bed and they have it. We had a jacuzi in our room and that was very nice. We loved the track lighting, the bistro table, the couch, the lite palm tree. The air conditioning was a window unit but kept the room chilly...just the way we prefer it. The breakfast was small but adequate...if staying again I would probably skip it and go out for breakfast, but that is because I love to eat breakfast out. The place is within walking distance to the zoo - which is a must if you have never been. I had no moldy or old smells in my room as a previous poster had. Enjoy your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for $”
Reviews.Author: VivaVacations
Reviews.Content: Nice little place. Building old but well maintained and clean. Our room was quite spacious and had a kitchen and small living room as well as adequate closet space. Breakfast was adequate, not huge. The balcony and its furnishings looked old but serviceable. It was very clean up there and comfortable place to enjoy the evening cool. The location for the Balboa park is great. A 10 to 15 min walk to the zoo a major bonus. The downside is that there are no stores or restaurants nearby. There is a bus stop very nearby (the #7 bus) that goes downtown and that solved most of our shopping/dining requirements during our 3 day - 2 night stay at Balboa Park inn. Staff were friendly and advice they gave was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Balboa Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: stevenbFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Balboa Park Inn for 7 nights this June. BPI is an excellent value for expensive San Diego. We typically stay at more upscale boutique hotels but decided on this place to save a bit. We were pleasantly surprised. The cleaning staff at the BPI keep this place spic and span. The courtyard areas are spotless, our room was kept spotless too. If I owned a hotel I would want that hard working staff to work at my place. Our suite (Southwest suites) was pretty spacious, small kitchen, comfortable bed, private patio. I never slept so well at a hotel. The overall look of the room/buildings are older and probably could use an update but not too shabby. I felt comfortable as the place is quiet and is nice to come back from a busy day to a quiet place. The fake flowers around are not my style but the real flowers and bushes are so nice. BPI is a few blocks drive to University Ave with has a ton of restaurants. You must must try breakfast at Hash House a go go in Hillcrest. I have never had such a huge and amazing/inventive breakfast. The place itself is an experience. Lei Lounge in University Heights is a must for a late tapas dinner. Very south beach like. If you normally stay at the ritz carlton, then you may not like it but otherwise I think this place was great. steve and jeff

Reviews.Title: “nice time at balboa”
Reviews.Author: lizandnorm
Reviews.Content: nice place,good for zoo and sites in park,plenty going on at weekends in the park. check out the car show on a saturday near to the Air and space museum Good bus service to take you downtown.Lots of resturants with in short walking distance.The hotel is very clean and tidy,housekeeping second to none,staff will give you adivce of what's going on near by.Nice gardens and patios to enjoy your breakfast or in the evening order yourself a pizza and a bottle of wine from 1 of the many takeaways that will deliver to the hotel reception ,When downtown I recomend the Fish Market Resturaunt next to the midway for an excellent meal

Reviews.Title: “know what you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: pat2
Reviews.Content: If you want sanitised luxury stay at the Marriott. On the other hand if you want a small older place with character, quirky and spacious themed rooms, floors a bit creaky, pretty courtyards, then this place is great. We had five days here in May. The hotel is on the north edge of Balboa Park so you're not downtown and the walk to the zoo entrance is 10 minutes and the museums another 5. The restaurants in Hillcrest are a 5 minute drive or an ok 30 minute walk away. Our room was spotless, continental breakfast delivered to the room was fine, service was good, staff were helpful, cabs came within a couple of minutes of us asking front desk($15 airport, $12 downtown). Its a great place if this is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location---Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: lchjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in April, and found the location on the northern fringe of Balboa Park to be perfect. It's in a relatively quiet area, and parking (on-street) is no problem. It's within walking distance of the zoo, and a great place to start a run, or a stroll up to the trendy Hiicrest area. Staff were friendly and helpful with restaurants, etc. The continental breakfast is delivered to your room within 5 minutes after you call, and was tasty and fresh. Our "apartment" had a separate sitting room and full kitchen, and was comfortable (although certainly not luxurious). Although our bedroom was well done, the furniture in the sitting room was not comfortable and could use an upgrade. But all in all, for the money (we paid $135/night) and considering the great location, this was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Manor”
Reviews.Author: OhioBuckeyeBOY
Reviews.Content: Greatly overrated, in my view. Front desk and support staff were great and the location is wonderful, but the facility is old and objectionable. I stayed here twice (frequent business traveler to San Diego) to be fair to the facility. On the first visit, there was a strong offensive musty odor in my quarters. Because I used it only as a sleeping room, I remained for several days. On arriving home, I discovered that all my clothing and luggage smelled moldy. Further, there are many electrical safety issues (I'm a firefighter). Code-violating extension cords under carpets, jury-rigged wiring tucked inappropriately behind moldings, electrical wiring run into walls without conduit, overloaded receptacles, all contributed to give me the heebie-jeebies regarding my safety while there. On my second stay, I found the same kitschy decor which has bothered some other reviewers, but I also found yet another unit with a strong objectionble odor of mold. This unit had evidence of water intrusion from leaks in roof (it's a flat roof with parapet walls, about one hundred years old, so no surprise). When I complained about the odor, the desk clerk acknowledged that they receive many complaints on this from throughout the buildings comprising the Inn. The owner was tight-lipped and not happy, but agreed fairly quickly to refund my prepaid lodging charges for what was to have been a five-day visit. I simply cannot recommend this lodging to anyone, but especially for those with allergies to mold or chronic respiratory diseases, this will be a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: Sam39
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end April 07 (booked direct with the hotel). These individually decorated suites are situated on the intersection of Park Boulevard and Upas Street. There are several seperate buildings contanining a few suites however each block had an access door that was locked. We had the Monet room which was in a block about 100 yards or so from reception. The suite we had was very spacious, with a bedroom, bathroom, kitchenette (including fridge, microwave, coffee maker and grill) and living room area (with big sofa and small tv). All the rooms in our suite were clean and well presented, the TV in the living area was smaller than the one in the bedroom, but there was a nice fireplace with an electric fire (not really a fire as in it didn't give out heat) which crackled nicely and lit up. The Monet has a balcony from the kitchen door that is shared with another unit. Our suite was on the first floor, up a fairly steep flight of stairs, and carrying heavy cases could be difficult for less able people. Parking was on the street, and we never had a problem finding a spot close to the hotel. During our stay the hotel was not full, and it was in a residential area with a school opposite so maybe parking could be more difficult at busier times. Breakfast was delivered to the room, you just had to ring down when you wanted it and it was there a few minutes later. The choice was pastries or cereals with fruit juice and a bowl of fruit, it was an adequate start to the day. The location was excellent, an easy 10 minutes stroll to the zoo. We drove to Fashion Valley Mall at Friars Road (about 10 minutes) to catch the trolley into the city, which was a better option for us than driving into downtown. Check in was very friendly and the staff very helpful and informative. There were restaurant on 'University Avenue’ however we had our meals in downtown and at the Fashion Valley mall where there were a few restaurants (including the Cheesecake Factory, Crocodile Cafe and PF Chang) along with lots of shops. There were menus in the hotel room for restaurants that delivered to the area which was a good idea. We did as other reviwers have metioned notice a smell of cleaning products when we entered the room however it did not bother us. The shower did have to be left running for ages to heat up however it eventually. We would stay again if we were in the area as it was clean, quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service, Bad Dwelling”
Reviews.Author: jaredavd
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night while visiting the zoo with my wife's family and it was right down the road from the zoo. The park was literally right across the street, so that was great too, and it was far enough away from the beach and downtown to avoid horrible parking and most undesirable people. There were a couple of shoeless hippies wandering around with walking sticks outside the inn in the morning. The staff was friendly and brought us an iron and ironing board with a tasty pastry and fruit breakfast in the morning. They let us check in a little early as well, which was very nice of them. I had the same problem as a previous reviewer-- the heat was on full blast when we first arrived. That wasn't too difficult to take care of, though. The buildings seem like very old apartments. All the floors creak and I can imagine that anyone staying below us would have heard every step we took on those old floors. The paint was peeling, the carpet seemed very old. It wasn't a bad place, just old and probably shouldn't be ranked #3. If you need to be close to the zoo and are only planning on doing the zoo and the museum, then this is a fair place. If you want to see any of the rest of san diego or socal, get something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the raves”
Reviews.Author: krispykremed
Reviews.Content: I am pretty surprised about the rave reviews from the Trip Advisor folks. On the recommendations my boyfriend and I stayed in the Courtyard Suite - a 70's era art deco room with a hottub. It was ok, but rather gawdy and a little musty. The B&B complex is clean enough, but old and dated. It is basically a motel. The front desk folks are real nice, but I would definitely NOT go here for a romantic getaway. It's too campy. From a convenience standpoint, it's close to the Zoo and close by drive to University, but the area's not the best and I wouldn't walk to University Drive. We did have an oversized hottub in the room but the courtyard area is small and we were afraid to turn the tub on or have a conversation because the room had a window that was mere feet from the other rooms and you can hear everything that comes from the Courtyard. It's a decent place for the price, but I would have rather stayed at a hotel somewhere else. It was too old and dated for a vacation/weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Monet room, not the best”
Reviews.Author: Willie123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monet room for 3 nights. Upon checking in, we went up to our room. The heat was blasting and the suite must have been about 95 degrees. The staff person with us commented how hot, but did nothing to fix the problem. We later figured out the air conditioning unit was set to the hottest temp, but it would have been nice if the staff person would have helped us with this issue. Great location. Large suites, but the TV in the living room is about 13 inches tall. The shower also didn't always have hot water. Very iffy if wanting to take a shower in the afternoon. Decor is a bit tacky. I wouldn't choose to stay here if visiting San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeCav
Reviews.Content: I was a fan of this place even before we arrived in San Diego from the east coast. Because of a flight cancellation on Saturday 4/14, the earliest flight the airline could book my family of four on was Tuesday 4/17. My 3 and 5 year old were dissapointed to say the least (my wife and I were'nt to happy either!). After spending hours trying to get a better flight, I finally gave up with American Airlines. Early Saturday morning I called and asked the folks at Balboa Park Inn if they would be kind enough to let us cancel the first 3 nights of our 4 night stay (spent the rest of the trip in Anaheim) - something they didn't have to do based on their cancellation policy. They understood and let us cancel. Although I was unhappy with the airlines, it was a little easier to swallow knowing that the Inn was flexable. We booked the Mayfair Suite - upon arriving late on Tuesday night we were extremely please with the room/suite. The place is huge! It felt like a home away from home, and we all slept like babies.... The next morning is when he had some time to really check the place out. As my son, daughter and I were exploring the welcoming courtyard - warm partries, fruit and juice were delived to our room to my wifes delight. The food was more than enough for my family of 4, and delicious! Unfortunatelly because our trip was cut short, we had to check out that morning and drive up to Anaheim for the Disney parks (after spending the day at the zoo). The Inn's location is easy to find and just a short walk to the zoo and Balboa park. We were dissapointed that we only had a chance to stay 1 night in such a wonderful place. Balbo Park Inn can count on us as being guests again in the future! - The Cavanaugh's

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: NJvacation
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Balboa Park Inn for a few days vacation in San Diego. We booked this place because of the wonderful reviews it recieved from tripadvisor - the reviewers were correct! This is a very good value! Large spacious rooms - nicely decorated and very clean. Wonderful location - we walked to the Zoo and were very close to Hillcrest, where we could find any kind of food imaginable! Breakfast is included but rather minimal. But this is not a major negative. In fact, the only potential negative is that the parking is on the street! We were always lucky to find parking but could imagine that this might be a problem during the more crowded summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Made me appreciate my own house!”
Reviews.Author: AlliefromLongBeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Balboa Inn expecting a great place to stay because of all the reviews. I can't believe that only a few people have negative things to say about this place. Do they weed them out? Where do I begin? 1. No elevators so we had to lug our luggage up a steep stairway. 2. Room smelled of musty odor that actually made me & my husband ill. 3. Bathroom was very outdated, especially the shower. 4. The plastic flowers gave it a tacky feeling all around. 5. Despite the claim that the place is quiet, we heard the jacuzzi motor from other rooms until 1am and we did hear the heavy footsteps of other people around. 6. Didn't see the warning sign on the door until the day we checked out that the property contains cancer causing material that can be harmful to someone who is pregnant. 7. We knew that the building was old, but we at least expected for a highly rated hotel, the owners would have remodeled to modern standards but it was in its original state just much older. 8. It was clean, but not immaculate. 9. The whole place just had a tacky feeling with cheap decor. Not a characteristic of an outstanding place to stay. 10. The breakfast was good but again, it's canned fruits and Costco pastries. We have stayed in other hotels in San Diego and I would say this is by far the worst. We stayed at the Hyatt Manchester, Double Tree, Embassy Suites and the Marriott. For the price, I think it's not worth it to stay here. We've gotten better bargains in those other hotels. We paid about $170 per night plus tax to get one of their bigger suites, but I could have paid the same for a Marriott Residence Inn and get a full breakfast and a pool. One thing I did learn is not to rely on all the glorious reviews you read on-line. Who wrote all those excellent reviews anyway? I actually feel bad writing this because the people that work there seem nice but I felt deceived by the #2 rating of this hotel and I'm afraid other people will be as disappointed as we were if they stay here expecting something great. After my stay at Balboa Park Inn, I came home appreciating my own house and mind you my house is not a big or elegant, just an average house.

Reviews.Title: “What's another word for Charm”
Reviews.Author: Pyronym
Reviews.Content: This Inn charmed us from the first entrance to the last minute of our stay. We stayed 2 nights because of the excellent location to the Zoo but the room was so beautifully appointed, we cooked a meal and enjoyed our surroundings. The rooms were very spacious and although older, was very comfortable. The staff were extremely friendly and I felt more at ease here than anywhere else I have ever stayed. Enamor, captivate, charisma, allure all equal a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nvgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Southwest suite. It was clean, quiet and a great place to stay. The grounds were spotless and the employees and front desk people were very friendly and helpful. We ordered takeout and they delivered it to the front desk. We walked to the zoo. Balboa park was beautiful and there are many museums and things for the kids to do. Parking was not a problem. It's a nice neighborhood and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Beach House (Room #29)”
Reviews.Author: tropicdiver
Reviews.Content: The nice stuff: I stayed here for only one nite (passing thru town) and was very pleased with our sleep over. The room was large, had a separate couch, as well as a fridge and a microwave oven. The bathroom is *huge* with a separate shower and also a very nice 5' Jacuzzi tub that is surrounded on one side by mirrors. The room was set in a beach type motif with fish hanging from the ceiling in the bathroom. The king size bed was very comfortable. The room was very clean. I had read earlier reports of water that wasn't barely warm and poor water pressure. I assure this was *not* the case in the Beach House. There was plenty of water pressure and hot water to go around. The nit picking: It rained while I was there during the nite and the a/c - heating unit is wall mounted and the water dripped dripped dripped onto the unit and made a lot of racket (I enjoy sleeping to the falling rain, but this was way too much). I would suggest they put some kind of awning above the unit, so the water would run off of it, instead of sounding like a snare drum inside the room. Parking is on the street, but that was a very minor problem for us, as we always managed to get a parking spot nearby. In closing, I would stay here, again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: judatt
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay - very convenient to lots of places. We literally walked to the zoo entrance in less than 10 minutes. We were traveling with another couple and stayed in a two bedroom suite. The queen size beds were very comfortable. We also had a full kitchen which we used very little and a nice living room with tv, writing desk, sofa and two comfortable chairs. The maid service was prompt each morning and they changed bath linens every day and bed linens every other day. We called the operater each morning and ordered breakfast and it was delivered about 30 minutes later. The front desk personnel were very helpful and friendly. If they didn't know the directions, they found out for us. I was a little concerned about parking on the street, but I must say we never had a problem. A couple of times we had to park across the street but it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “charming ambience - make you feel like a local”
Reviews.Author: iloveolives
Reviews.Content: Bottom line - this is a truly delightful and comfortable apartment style bed and breakfast with all the mod cons. The location is very convenient especially if you are a first time visitor to SD as we were. The proximity to the Zoo and all the lovely museums and gardens of Balboa Park make it very attractive. Our family ( 2 adults + 2 teens) had the California Suite which is on the ground floor but extremely quiet and secure. Very comfortable queen bed, and the sofa bed was ok as well, but probably could be replaced soon.The decor is sunny and homey and really makes you feel you are at home not in a decorators showroom! Bathroom is compact but had everything. Good towels, kitchen well fitted out with full size fridge.We did all our cooking , and we enjoyed eating in the little dining area.The best place to shop for groceries is the Whole Foods store in University Ave towards Hillsborough( for overseas visitors it is a chain of upmarket organic food store with a huge cheese and wine section, fish, bread etc - fantastic). The service at the desk was friendly and v. helpful. Another good service is the housekeeping will do your laundry for a small fee ( the same as you would pay in a coin laundry for a couple of loads). Breakfast was very generous with good quality pastries, fruit and juice- unless you are v. picky you don't need to buy breakfast anywhere else. Parking was fine especially if you came back in the late afternnon. Finally I was amazed at how quiet it was. Overall very enjoyable and if you don't enjoy the big hotel scene and especially if you are visiting with a family this is the only place to stay in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: rosiered723
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to San Diego for a romantic getaway, and loved this place! We stayed in the Monet Suite and was well worth it. It was bigger than my first apartment, they only thing it didn't have was a stove, but no need. There's a toaster oven, microwave, coffeemaker and fridge. Off the kitchen was a balcony shared with the next suite, but we didn't actually have neighbors. Our bed was super comfy, nice plush pillow top and plenty of pillows. T.V. in the bedroom and living room. The bathroom was clean, full size tub. The living room was cozy and had a faux fireplace. The t.v. in the living room actually had a dvd player in it too. The location was great. Nice and quiet at night. We walked to the park and zoo. We did take a cab one night to the Gaslamp Quarter, but it was only $8 plus tip. The very friendly staff was kind enough to call us the cab. Breakfast was delivered to our room, and was more than enough! We definitely enjoyed our stay and hope to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funny little place”
Reviews.Author: bevanderson98
Reviews.Content: This place is really cool if you want a laid-back, kind of kitschy sort of place. We stayed for two nights in the Courtyard Suite- an odd mix of oriental and Grandma decor. But there was a jacuzzi tub and champagne bucket! which made the stay! All of their rooms are different. We wanted to try the Jungle Room but it was booked. The location is great- just a short walk to the zoo and nearby the University/Hillcrest area. We randomly went out in this area and as a straight couple in the "gayborhood" (as they called it), we were welcomed with open arms in the local bar. Fun place.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Monkey Time!”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: what a fun little place this is! We stayed in the Jungle Nook with the Brass Monkey watching every move and a giant elephant head over the bed. we didn't see any other rooms. I was struck with how much care and attention went into creating the room - all the walls were painted with murals of animals and plants, all the furnishings were in the theme, all the crockery etc etc. we had extra christmas decorations in the room - so it was a bit crowded in there. Room had almost everything you could want in a room - microwave, fridge, coffee maker, plenty of toiletries - and a full range. there was a double shower and a two person jacuzzi. There were 2 TVs - so we watched It's a Wonderful Life from the comfort of our warm bubbly jacuzzi - and there was another TV for the bedroom. a separate bathroom had two basins etc. There was plenty of clothes hanging and luggage racks. the only thing missing was a hair dryer. the included breakfast was juice, either cereal or a HUGE basket of pastries, fruit (fresh grapes, apple, watermelon and tinned pineapple & peaches). Great location - walk to the zoo and Balboa Park museums, we drove up to University Ave in 5 mins for heaps of restaurants. We ate at the Ortega Baja/Mexican - best mexican/baja we've had on the whole trip! All up me and my swinging monkey friend were pretty happy!

Reviews.Title: “Your own little apartment in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Kitters
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! We rented the Monet Suite--3 rooms done in lovely pastel colors--although the silk flower bouquets were a bit overwhelming. Kitchen includes dishes, a large refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker, and table/chairs. The breakfast brought to our room each morning offered enough options that we always had plenty. We walked to the zoo which is basically just across the street and around the corner. We spent a day and a half at Balboa Park and did not begin to see everything. Except for the Cafe on Park (which was closed on the day we arrived) there are no restaurants within a reasonable walking distance. However, San Diego has so many places with great restaurants like the Gaslamp Quarter and Old Town that we sampled a different spot each night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for families!”
Reviews.Author: christine182
Reviews.Content: We loved this place and will absolutely stay here again and again! My husband, I, and our 4 and 1 yr old girls stayed two nights in the Suite Cycles suite. First, It was spotlessly clean, our number one requirement, and we weren't bothered at all by the housecleaning scent (rather assured by it, actually, but if you have allergies to scented cleaners/disinfectants, you may want to stay somewhere else). Also, the price is incredible, I really could not believe we were staying somewhere so great for so cheap. Every other decent place in town for a suite was at least $210 a night. Even though each room in the Inn was booked, it was incredibly quiet and peaceful. It was like having our own apartment, we settled right in. Our 4 yr old loved having her own fold out bed in the livingroom, and there was enough space next to it for our toddler's pack n play (we brought it with us, but the Inn offered a crib for $10 if we had needed it). The livingroom TV had lots of channels and great reception, but there is no TV in the bedroom, so if you plan to relax in that room after putting your kids to bed in the livingroom, you'll want to bring a portable DVD (that's what we did). The breakfast is delivered right to your door whenever you want it in the morning, and it was plenty of food to get us started for our day at the zoo (and for just 2 paid adults, there was plenty to share with our kids, so don't pay for an extra breakfast for little ones). People here that have complained about the quality of the breakfast fare must be very hard to please, as we found it to be perfectly fine. It isn't gourmet, just some cut fruits, juice, and store-bought pastries, but heck, it's tasty and filling and you don't have to leave your room! As everybody else has noted, the walk to the zoo is quick and it is a lovely and safe neighborhood. Both days we came back to the suite and let our kids nap, it was SO quiet, we never even heard housekeeping. Never had a problem finding parking, even though we walked to most places, so didn't have to re-park very often. In addition to the zoo, there are other family things to do within walking distance: Balboa Park museums, a carousel, train ride, and Morley Field, which has a playground and tons of running around space. Great restaurants in this area too: Cafe on Park was recommended by the Inn, and it was great, they love kids there! We also ate at the following Hillcrest restaurants, all super: Hash House a Go Go, Taste of Thai, Bacione Ristorante, and Bronx Pizza. Wow, we just could not have found a better place to stay in San Diego! Thanks to the Balboa Park Inn, we look forward to many more trips to SD in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Unusual, and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: jtretakoff
Reviews.Content: Picture several suburban homes on a corner..then picture connecting them all, and doing them all as an Inn. Now you have the Balboa Park Inn. Each room is a masterpiece: great theme (we stayed in the Orient Express), and great amenities. The Inn is funny. The three buildings are connected by means of meandering paths and walkways, interrupted by tables and lounges. There is no main area of the Inn; it's literally three homes that have been joined together. The location can't be beat: literally across the street from Balboa Park, you can walk to the Zoo. It's a suburban neighborhood: very quiet at night, sometimes hard to park at night. I'd advise staying here when school is not in session, as the school is directly across from the Inn. The rooms are the attraction here, and they don't disappoint. Luxurious, well done. Quite a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “My husband loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelinbunny
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to Tripadvisor recommendations. I'm glad we did! There was a musty/vacant smell about the room the first time we walked in but this is nothing a few candles couldn't fix. The staff was super friendly and the room was ready for us when we arrived, meaning they had even turned a few lamps on so we wouldn't be walking into a dark room. The location is fabulous and the ammenities were excellent. Breakfast delivered free to your door every morning, with the newspaper, a ton of TV channels that come in clearly, a refrigerator & microwave, too. We were even able to find Wi-Fi in our room. There was no water pressure in the shower, though, and the bathroom was a bit small. We stayed in the Suite Escape room. Overall, we'd definitely stay there again. I'd even go back to the same room. My husband, by the way, absolutely loved the place. If you stay here you should definitely eat at Cafe on Park, which is a nice walk up the street. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “This place is absolutely charming!”
Reviews.Author: Zxin
Reviews.Content: I stumbled across this place quite by accident just surfing the web... WHAT A FIND! * Charming room (very romantic) * Bed very comfortable. * Bathroom was spotless (as was the whole room). * Jacuzzi tub was a blast. My girlfriend (who is very well traveled) just loved the room. We can't wait to come back, and visit again. The folks who run the inn are very hospitable and are just great folks all around. -Tom San Diego, California

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: mere97
Reviews.Content: Given the stellar reviews we've read on this site, my husband and I were disappointed to discover that the Balboa Park Inn was not as wonderful as we had expected. The location IS fabulous - we spent a lot of time enjoying Balboa Park, the museum, etc., but other than having a really high "kitsch" factor (the plastic flowers in the outdoor flower beds are really funny), the Inn itself left us wondering what the fuss is about. Our room was very neat and clean - we stayed in the Orient Express room (which is really pretty great) - it's like being inside an old Asian brothel - very low light with red and black theme. It was disappointing that the breakfast was so average - canned fruit in the fruit salad and some run-of-the-mill, store bought pastries - for the price ($175 per night), I guess we thought there might be more effort put into breakfast. Even offering yogurt would take it up a notch. Finally, while everyone we met on the staff was very friendly, we were extremely disappointed to find that when we asked for local directions at the front desk, neither woman working there could help us. One said "Oh, I don't live around here" and the other just said "I have no idea". It seems to me that part of offering excellent service should include a staff that is at least familiar with the surrounding area...so, all in all, we thought it was just O.K. As much as we appreciate a funky, kitschy vibe, we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only Wonderful Surprises”
Reviews.Author: buppie
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I spent 3 nights at Balboa Park Inn. Honestly, these guys (Ed and Judy) run an AMAZING place! A great bargain and uncommonly CLEAN. Very attentive and friendly staff. We felt like we were at home. We will sleep no place else in San Diego. We took a few pics, take a look! signed, Philip S. Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “What a Little Gem! Definitely give this a try!”
Reviews.Author: guest1968
Reviews.Content: We were so glad that we chose this Inn based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. We stayed in the MayFair Suite which is the largest suite they have. It was like staying in an apartment. Two good sized bedrooms, a living room, bathroom and full kitchen. This room is nicely decorated with charm and the bathroom had been remodeled and updated. Lots of nice touches throughout that made it comfortable and cozy. There were two AC units, one in kitchen and one in living room so the whole place stayed a nice temperature. There was a t.v. in the living room and one in one of the bedrooms. Breakfast was served every day to our room and consisted of assorted hot pastries, juice and a big bowl of fruit. After reading some of the complaints about the food we were not sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. It was absolutely plenty of food for the four of us. The fruit bowls probably had about 2 cups of fruit in them and their were always at least three different kinds of assorted pastries warm and yummy in our basket. Plenty for us all to get our fill. It was always enough food to get us started and they offer to serve it to you either in your room or out on the patio. We were so exhausted after our trips to Sea World and the zoo that we ordered in two of the three nights we stayed there. The lady at the front desk recommended some places and she was right on the money. The first dinner was from China Wok which was very tasty. The second was from Florencia's which I can't recommend enough and was so much food we had half of it the next night. Delivery was fast and friendly so definitely ask what the staff recommends for dining out or in as the suggestions will most likely make you happy. The inn is literally a 5 minute walk to the zoo and it is a nice walk past a park and school. We stayed during the week and heard no school noise and very little traffic noise even though one side of the Inn is on a busy street. The AC units prob blocked a lot of that out so I'm not sure what it would sound like if you weren't running them. We would definitely stay here again and prob this same room as other rooms get mixed reviews. I can recommend this one with confidence though.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, but not as great as I had my hopes on”
Reviews.Author: CMINIGO
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more based on all the reviews written here, but I'm sure that's the only fault with the Balboa Inn. I booked the Oriental Express room for a romantic, get-away surprise for my fiancé’s birthday in July. We spent the first half of the day at the SD Zoo, which is literally walking distance from the Inn! That was great as you're also close to lovely Balboa Park and only 12 minutes from the Harbor (where we went on a harbor dinner cruise- my advice is those aren't worth the $, so don’t bother). Our room was clean. The couch, comforter, bed linens, towels, and things just felt old and dusty. The room was much smaller than expected which came as quite a surprise. The themed decoration was neat though and helped make up for what it lacked in size. The smoke-tinted mirror over the bed was fun but took some getting used to. The bathroom was ok with an older tile lshower, standard single sink, and a tub. They did leave a lovely candelabrum near the tub, filled with new taper candles and a book of matches. That was a nice touch. The toilet was in a separate room, which was all black, which also took some getting used to (even a black toilet!). At night I discovered the light in the toilet room didn't work, which was a pain but nothing we could fix and the scary Chinese mask on the wall looked scarier in the dark. After having enough to drink you’d swear it was moving. Our stay was quiet and we heard no other guests. This is definitely a place for couples only. We had a great time overall, but wouldn’t come back to the same place. It was fun for what it was, but nothing I’d want to do again. I think the best thing was the amazing omelet breakfast we had at “Café on Park” down the street, as recommended by the hotel front desk. The intimate gay art on the walls was a bit much to digest while eating, but the food was killer! This place is a great value and the location is prime. Just don’t expect too much and you’ll be pleased. And yes, there is a school directly across the street, so beware if you stay during the week, it will be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Lots of Chraracter and Friendly Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: maighdlin
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a weekend at the Balboa Park Inn with our 20 month old daughter. We chose it because of the great reviews that it had here on Trip Advisor and felt that it lived up to just about everything that we read. The Inn is really easy to find, as it is literally right across the street from the Zoo and Balboa Park, so you can pretty much follow signs from just about anywhere and get there with no trouble. It only took us about 15 mintues from the airport in our rental car. It is also close to downtown. We didn't really venture around the nearby neighborhoods, but on the way there, we saw lots of nice restaurants and coffee shops, so I'm sure there are lots of them around.
