Check in was easy and despite what some of the reviews here say, we did have help from the staff lugging our bags up to the room. We stayed in the Monet Suite and it was very nice and much bigger than we had anticipated. It was literally like having your own apartment. There was a nice livingroom with a comfy couch, two chairs, a table, tv with dvd player and a nice fake fireplace. It felt very homy and comfortable. The bathroom had fairly new fixtures and was very clean, however the plumbing was really noisy sometimes...but, not enough to be a nuisance. The bedroom was plenty big and had a really comfy bed, dresser w/mirror, a tv, two nightstands with lamps and a closet that fit our big suitcase on a stand. The kitchen was bigger than we imaged as well. it had a table with two chairs, utensils, glasses and plates, a microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker and large refrigerator. They supply plenty of coffee (regular and decaf), sugar, creamer and hot chocolate. We also had a deck that we shared with another unit, that was nice to eat breakfast on in the morning. Others mentioned the plastic flowers outside and some said that they found them tacky and silly, but to be honest....they mix these flowers with real ones, plus there are lots of trees and such on the decks and patios as well. I didn't really even notice them, to be honest. I don't think I would have even realized that they were plastic, had I not read it on Trip Advisor ahead of time. The breakfasts were nothing special, but they were enough to tide us over for a little while. You got fresh fruit and juice and a choice of cereal or pastries. Like others have said, the rooms are exceptionally clean. We asked directions and suggestions from Robbi at the front desk and she was very, very helpful and friendly. Our room was fairly quiet, the rooms aren't soundproofed well, but we didn't find it to be a problem at all. The only suggestion that I would have for the folks at the Balboa Park Inn would be to put irons and ironing boards in the rooms. It would make things much easier on the guests!! :-) I know that other guests mentioned a cleaning smell of some kind, but I didn't really notice it and I have allergies and asthma, so it must not be all that bad. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. It is clean, fun and much more room than you'd get at a chain hotel for twice as much money. If you're looking for cookie cutter, boring hotel room then I would avoid the Balboa Park Inn, but if you're looking for a clean, friendly, cozy place with character.....definitely stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, pleasant accomodations”
Reviews.Author: maria12134
Reviews.Content: I chose balboa park inn based on it's number # 1 rating for San Diego. At the last second my husband was unable to travel with me and I was very hesitant about staying at a bed and breakfast alone with 2 children! However the staff at BPI went out of their way to make us feel welcome. This is a charming inn with all the personal touches, attentive employees, great value in a great location. My only regret is that they won't rent jacuzzi tub rooms to people with children due to insurance issues, so that limits selection greatly. Some type of liability waiver would be great, as I was dissapointed in missing out on the Jungle Room! (Also, a small pool would have been greatly appreciated in the heat!) I had no issue with parking even though I am a terrible parallel parker, and the neighborhood was very safe. I recommend balboa park inn to any traveler and will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a great getaway with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: gene1431
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that I went into this web listing just to see pictures and etc. I am a frequent visitor and I will not be back there for a couple of months and I was missing its charm, I have stayed in this bed and breakfast for several years now, and have always been treated with the upmost respect by the front desk and by the maid service, the place is so charming filled with old world charm which you do not find anywhere. It is nice to stay where each room is decorated in a different theme and finished with the most beautiful fabrics right down to the finest detal, which makes it fun and exciting. (our favorite room is called the Park Place) I also want to comment on how perfect the Inn is kept and how perfect the grounds are kept, even to the detail when flowers are not in bloom or in season the owner/manager has placeed expensive silk flowers and foilage in areas to bring extra life and color for his or her quests to enjoy. I look forward to a return visit in the fall and always await to see what will be new and exciting. I also must add the location is perfect and easy to get to other areas of the city, and walking distance to the Zoo and Balboa park. Gene a very happy visitor from Minneapolis, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location and a really laid back atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Okie2
Reviews.Content: Firstly, to echo other reviews, this place is an upscale motel, and not a true B&B or hotel. If you go stay here expecting the full American B&B treatment, then you will be disappointed. We paid $99 dollars a night for the Aruba room for two nights, and for San Diego that's cheap even by motel standards. Considering what we paid, we thought this place was fantastic! Location wise, this place is just a few minutes stroll from the entrance to San Diego Zoo (best zoo in the world in my opinion), and a short drive from Hillcrest and other sites...it's also close enough to the freeway to get to Seaworld easily. The room itself was small but came with a huge bathroom with a great jetted tub, and an outside table to enjoy the motel's enclosed and secluded courtyard. Breakfast was simple, but served to our door each morning at the time we specified. We thought the 'aquatic' theme in the room (cuddly toy fishes dangling on strings from the ceiling!?), and the colourful courtyard were both really fun! And most importantly, everything was totally clean. Okay, so some of the flowers in the courtyard are plastic, and the room themes are a little over the top...but we thought this just added to the fun of the place...it doesn't take itself too seriously, which makes for a great place to just relax. The owners have obviously gone to a lot of effort...it's just that it might not be to everyone's taste. I'd definitely recommend this as a great place to stay, provided that over-the-top room themes make you laugh rather than cringe. And one final thing...we were recommended a local diner by the lady at the front desk, and I had possibly the best burger ever there...it's called Brian's and it's just a few blocks from the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the Balboa Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: matt1978matt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Balboa Park Inn while we were in San Diego for the Comic Con, and we had an excellent stay. We booked the Courtyard Suite, and the room was fantastic. Comfortable bed, neat-o decorations, and a jacuzzi tub to boot. The property is very pretty, and the roof seating is a nice place to hang out. We were able to easily walk to the zoo, and it wasn't too hard to find our way around from the inn to other locations in the city. The only things that would really help would be wifi in each room, and maybe a less complicated alarm clock in the Courtyard Suite. Other than that, it's an fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A full on assault of the senses.”
Reviews.Author: MissChris
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay in the greystoke room, which didn't look that bad in the website photos. In reality it's a hideous animal theme gone overboard with stuffed animals on every surface looking at you. Maybe this would be good if you had kids, but certainly not for any kind of romance (unless you're into that). There is a giant stuffed leopard opposite the bed under a huge painting of a naked man with a big snake. To make this even worse,the room smelled horribly of disinfectant cleaner and some king of air freshener. It was unbearable. We decided we just couldn't stay there, and went to complain only to find out that someone had smoked in that room the night before and they were trying to cover the smell. They changed us to another room immediately. The next room was all pink and peach floral, basically your standard frou frou bed and breakfast room circa 1980, but with mirrors every wear, I mean every where, and spotlights on the bed. It didn't smell nearly as bad, just a hint of yucky air freshener. To top this all off, the flowers inside and outside are fake. Let me clarify, the flowers in the ground and around the courtyard are all plastic. I would never stay here again. In this case, "eclectic" is just another word for tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the park, quiet and cozy”
Reviews.Author: cityparents
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Beach House and were impressed with the decor of the room and the service. The hotel has its own secured courtyard area with benches, so you can read or eat breakfast outside in the morning. The room was large and included a little breakfast table and sofa, but not very much closet space. The hotel is only a 5-10 minute walk from the zoo and other attractions of Balboa Park. It is also a reasonably close drive to the freeways and the Gaslamp Quarter downtown. We did not have a problem finding parking on the street. I thought the restaurants on University Avenue were too far away to walk to, but the tradeoff is you are able to walk to the park. The area is not as lively as Gaslamp, but also not as noisy. A great place for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice. I'd stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Katze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at Balboa Park Inn. I first have to say that the location is awesome. Balboa Park ended up being a big highlight to our trip to San Diego, and it was great being beside it. We stayed in City Lights, which is a bargain for $99/night. Housekeeping lugged our heavy suitcases up the stairs to our room- those girls are strong! We really liked the room - it was very clean and spacious. The amenities are nice - with tea, hot chocolate, and coffee and all the fixings in the room. There was a microwave and mini fridge in the room, which was great for heating up leftovers, which saved us money. The breakfast is nice. They brought it within 10 minutes of calling every morning. Great service. We did have some plumbing problems in our bathroom. The toilet was having tons of problems, and we ended up getting upgraded free of charge to The Courtyard Suite for the last night of our stay. This suite was so incredibly eclectic! It was crazy with tons of mix-matched pieces of decor, but we liked it. The huge jacuzzi tub was awesome. I don't think I'd pay $169/night for the room though. The smaller City Lights room was just fine. I have to say the beds in both rooms were the best! I liked them just as much as Westin's heavenly beds, which says a lot. If you need to have internet access, good luck. We were able to tap into a free, public wireless connection when we were in the City Lights room but not in the Courtyard Suite. The person at the front desk couldn't help us. My husband ended up sitting on the step outside the building where City Lights is and accessing wireless that way. The hotel should consider offering internet service. Parking was free on the street and if you can parallel park, you'll be fine. We didin't have any troubles finding spots within a block of the hotel. If you don't want to spend a lot of money on your hotel and you don't need business services, such as internet, this hotel is a great choice. It's refreshing to find a hotel with character. I get so sick of the cookie-cutter rooms like you find in chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We live in Los Angeles and visit San Diego frequently. For the past 15 - 20 years we have been staying at the Balboa Park Inn. We find it a hidden treasure in the midst of a bustling city. Those accustomed to the sameness of city hotels will find this quaint bed and breakfast to be a refreshing relief. Most rooms we have stayed in were suites with various motifs ranging from victorian to the ribald. No two are alike. It is located within walking distance of Griffith Park, the Zoo, Globe Theater Complex and 10 minutes from downtown. Prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1BR suite at the Balboa Park Inn one Friday evening in May '06 after a week's stay in San Diego. When our other hotel couldn't accommodate the last day of our stay, I chose this hotel because of it's #1 ranking on the Trip Advisor website, but I was somewhat disappointed with it overall. (We probably had been spoiled by having such a nice suite at the Glorietta Bay Hotel in Coronado - for not much more than the $189/night that we paid for this room). While the staff was nice enough at check in, I thought it was kind of strange that if you wanted to have a hair dryer, iron or ironing board, they 'lent' them to you upon check-in and asked that you take them to your room (were they afraid you might steal them, or could they not afford to provide one in each room? What's next the coffeemaker?) Overall the buildings and our room in particular left a lot to be desired. This hotel is made up of several older homes. The bougainvillea climbing flowers were beautiful in the courtyards, but our room was on the second floor in a building down the street. We were all tired after a long day of sightseeing and weren't impressed when we unexpectedly had to lug all of our suitcases up the carpeted steps by ourselves. The room was awkwardly laid out with a bedroom in what would have been a dining room and a sofa bed in the kitchen. While everything seemed to be clean, the room was hot and muggy. Fortunately, there was a security screen door off the public bedroom (i.e., dining room) that we could lock, but leave open to help the place cool off while we were at dinner. Note, there are no restaurants nearby this hotel, so you must drive to another area to get something to eat. The beds and bathroom were fine, but not as nice as we had hoped for from a #1 ranked hotel. In the morning, I got a little frustrated because we couldn't use the coffee maker and the microwave oven (I like hot milk with my coffee) at the same time without tripping the circuit breaker. We had no problem calling down for breakfast and it was nice that they delivered it to our room. Breakfast was ample and delicious (we opted for fruit cup and pastries), but we thought that since our "family sized" room rented for four people and we had 3 adults and a child, they should have given us 4 breakfasts, not just three (it's not like they gave us a discount because we had a child and only 3 adults). We ate outside on the large upstairs deck and enjoyed the beautiful San Diego weather. While there were plenty of chairs, the deck was a bit run down and could use some attention. And, seeing the rats nest of electrical wires that were overhead and going into the buildings, I could understand why the breakers kept tripping. Upon check-out, after multiple trips up and down the stairs to get all our suitcases back to our rental and returning the hair dryer to the front desk, the desk clerk said he wasn't surprised by our microwave/coffee pot electrical problem, stating that these old homes were built in the 1930's and all had a lot of wiring issues.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Alva One
Reviews.Content: We chose the Balboa Park Inn based on Tripadvisor and spent three nights recently. The location is terrific (though parking can be a problem). Our room (Chinese theme) was well worn. Other rooms we saw looked better. it isn't that inexpensive, but seems overly cheap, from the single ply CostCo toilet paper to the paper plates and canned peaches in the fruit salad. The people are friendly. So as a place to stay while doing San Diego, it's OK, but don't expect anything special.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: Admin
Reviews.Content: I was so glad we made the decision to stay at this wonderful place in San Diego on our recent visit! The staff is absolutely magnificent - so friendly and helpful! Each room is different and while this isn't a brand new place, it is well maintained and very clean. The breakfast comes to your room when you order it. We had fresh warm croissants, pastries and a large bowl of fruit for each person. There is a coffee maker and fridge in the room. We walked to the zoo and there is a shuttle bus around Balboa Park. The bus stop is right across the street and it will take you to where you can board the trolley. We were concerned about parking on the street, but we never had a problem. The only small concern we had was that this is a residential neighborhood and therefore you must drive somewhere for dinner. It would have been nice to have a restaurant close by after a long day at the zoo. However, Hillcrest is just a couple of miles away and there are many great restaurants. A local suggested a small restaurant named Arreviderci in the Hillcrest neighborhood, and it was excellent! Other reviewers have lamented that this isn't a traditional B&B. We found it even better! I have never stayed anywhere with a staff more eager to please! We can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaGail
Reviews.Content: In town recently for the marathon and checked hotels in "TripAdvisor. Why not start at the top. I ended my search right away and booked the Balboa Park Inn based on the reviews. I wasn't disappointed. It was different from the large hotel scene in big cities. A super location, very clean we were charmed. I would definitely book again. lp

Reviews.Title: “Balboa Park Inn Is a Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ASatisfiedVisitor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Balboa Park Inn for extended periods of time since November 2003 and have found each stay to be delightful. My most recent visit was in March 2006. The suites are beautifully decorated and exceptionally clean. A friendly and helpful staff makes each visit enjoyable. I love walking around the balcony overlooking the courtyard with its beautiful plants. This balcony connects with a large sun terrace. The plants and attractive teakwood furniture provide a lovely place to have breakfast or just sit and relax. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Balboa Park Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3402 Park Blvd., San Diego, CA 92103
